abstracts.cdata!:
The Bridge Rehabilitation Project will
            contribute to the preservation of the Russian road network
            through a program of bridge rehabilitation, replacement and
            maintenance.  The principal objectives of the project are
            to: 1) improve the condition of selected high priority
            bridges on the federal and regional road systems, and
            interchanges with high traffic levels on federal highways;
            2) assist in reform of the institutional structure of road
            administration and the contracting industry, and further the
            use of competitive bidding; 3) strengthen the capabilities
            of the Federal Highway Department of the Russian Federation
            (FHD) to manage the bridges under its jurisdiction; 4)
            reduce a backlog of bridge rehabilitation and maintenance on
            regional roads for up to five participating regions, namely
            Kirov, Leningrad, Novgorod, Tver and Vologda Oblasts and
            Moscow City; and 5) improve the administrative, technical,
            and financial relationship of FHD and the regions of the
            Russian Federation.  The main components of the project are:
            1) bridge works on federal and regional roads including
            rehabilitation, repair, reconstruction, replacement, and
            widening of about 200-300 high priority federal and regional
            bridges and the improvement of 2-3 interchanges on the
            federal highways including grade separation; 2) bridge
            management equipment comprising vehicles, equipment,
            materials and supplies as an aid for better management of
            bridges; and 3) technical assistance, design and supervision
            of works and traning, including specialized consultants.
